title: Can I buy a Kindle and get only free books? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would not say all but, almost all the books I can guarantee that! There are a lot of ways by which you can read free books on Kindle but I think the best way would be by using Calibre. I am a regular Kindle user for more than 2 years now and I use this trick for most of my books. You need to have a software called Calibre on your Desktop/Laptop. This software will enable you to transfer files from your PC/Laptop to your Kindle. This software can also be used to read books on your PC. The important part of this software is the ability to convert one format to another. The Kindle supported format is MOBI. You can put other formats like Pdf and Azw3 and they would still be visible but, the experience would not be great. So it is best if you convert the format into MOBI. Using Calibre you can convert any format Like PDF, Epub to Mobi and you can enjoy the book in your Kindle. There are just 3 simple steps. A) Google the name of the book which you want to read. Almost 99% of the book which you want to read would be already available online. One hack here is that try searching in double-quotes to get great results. For example - Think and grow rich free download instead of this, try this search, “Think and grow rich free download” It will give you exact and more accurate results. B) The second step would be to convert the book into MOBI format.  Wait till the conversion is done. The Jobs section in the bottom right shows the number of conversions which are pending. C) Transfer the book to Kindle.  In this way, you can read almost any book for free. You would need to purchase very few books if you follow this trick. Hope it helps. Happy reading :-)

There are millions of books in the Kindle store that are free. You can read every single one of them for free. However, if you are interested in specific titles that are not free in the Kindle store, you will have to wait for a free promotion which may or may happen. Most books by renowned authors will never be available for free. There might be times when they are available at significant discounts though. If you are a voracious reader, the Kindle Unlimited program might help you to read a lot of books by paying an annual subscription fee. Do note that even Kindle Unlimited does not cover all the books in the Kindle store.

In Iowa, and i am sure in many other states, there is a program through the your public library that allows you do to down load free e-books. Just like paper books from the library, you rent them for a couple weeks at a time. While not every book is there, new titles are added all the time. You can also find other free e-book resources through the your public library. So to answer your question, I don't know that you can down load every book, but you can find enough to keep you busy reading for a very long time.

Read Kindle Books For Free. Did you know you can read Kindle books for free without actually buying a Kindle? Amazon has released a free app which allows users to download Kindle books on phones, tablets and PCs. Amazon’s Kindle app uses Whisper sync technology which enables users to download any book instantly, it literally takes seconds for your book to appear. You can also add bookmarks as well as make notes and highlights across any of the devices you use the app on, including the Kindle if you happen to have one. This means you can read a book on your phone, add a bookmark, then pick up where you left off on any of your other devices.

If you read 1 book a month and it cost say Rs.200 each, you will end up spending Rs.2800 in a year. Thats fine i think right for the value books gives us. Keep reading, learning and implementing! Regards Jimmy Chauhan
